Description: A small, pointed flake of brown flint: set into a stick of round section. The stick is broken at the butt, but is otherwise in a good state of preservation.
Curator's comments: The use of this object is uncertain. Petrie suggested that it was a tatooing instrument (W. M. F. Petrie, 'Royal Tombs of the Earliest Dynasties' II, 24). Bibliography: W. M. F. Petrie, 'Royal Tombs of the Earliest Dynasties' II, 24-5, pl.VI, 15.
